message.content:
{"id": "12398", 
"title": "Accessibility problems", 
"description": "When I launch the Help view, I need to first click on one of the 'live' areas before it starts working (e.g. the banner with the tool buttons, the nav frame or the content frame).", 
"OB": "The tab key does not respond in the Help view when launched.", 
"EB": "The tab key should be functional in the Help view upon launch.", 
"SR": "On March 26, 2002, on Windows 2000, the tab key does not have any effect when I launch the Help view."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '12398', 'title': 'Bug 12398Accessibility problems', 'description': 'Bug 12398Accessibility problems I needto first click on one of the "live" areas before it starts working (eg. thebanner with the tool buttons, the nav frame or the content frame. ', 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': '20020326, Win2KWhen I launch the Help view, the tab key does not actually do anything. '}
